00015 /**
00016  *  @brief  Retrieves cost from Concorde data structure.
00017  *  @param  problem [in] pointer to arrow_problem structure
00018  *  @param  i [in] id of starting node
00019  *  @param  j [in] id of ending node
00020  *  @return cost between node i and node j
00021  */
00022 inline int 
00023 concorde_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j);

00026 /****************************************************************************
00027  * Public function implemenations
00028  ****************************************************************************/
00029 int
00030 arrow_problem_read(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00031 {
00032     int size;
00033     
00034     /* Get Concorde to read and populate its data structure */
00035     if(CCutil_gettsplib(file_name, &size, &(problem->data)) != 0)
00036     {
00037         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to read TSPLIB file using Concorde\n");
00038         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00039     }
00040 
00041     problem->size = size;
00042     problem->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00043     problem->name = NULL;
00044     problem->get_cost = concorde_get_cost;
00045     
00046     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00047 }
00048 
00049 void
00050 arrow_problem_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00051 {
00052     /* Free Concorde's data structure */
00053     if(&(problem->data) != NULL)
00054     {
00055         CCutil_freedatagroup(&(problem->data));
00056     }
00057 }
00058 
00059 int
00060 arrow_problem_info_get(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info)
00061 {
00062     arrow_bintree tree;
00063     int ret;
00064     int i, j;
00065     int cost, min_cost, max_cost;
00066     
00067     ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00068     arrow_bintree_init(&tree);
00069     min_cost = INT_MAX;
00070     max_cost = INT_MIN;
00071         
00072     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00073     {
00074         for(j = i + 1; j < problem->size; j++)
00075         {
00076             /* Add to binary tree */
00077             cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00078             ret = arrow_bintree_insert(&tree, cost);
00079             if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS) goto CLEANUP;
00080             
00081             /* Determine min and max costs */
00082             if(cost < min_cost) min_cost = cost;
00083             if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00084         }
00085     }
00086     
00087     /* Convert tree to array */
00088     arrow_bintree_to_array(&tree, &(info->cost_list));
00089     info->cost_list_length = tree.size;
00090     info->min_cost = min_cost;
00091     info->max_cost = max_cost;
00092     
00093 CLEANUP:
00094     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00095     return ret;
00096 }
00097 
00098 void
00099 arrow_problem_info_destruct(arrow_problem_info *info)
00100 {
00101     if(info->cost_list != NULL)
00102         free(info->cost_list);
00103 }
00104 
00105 void
00106 arrow_problem_print(arrow_problem *problem)
00107 {
00108     int i, j, k, count;
00109     int group_size = 8;
00110     
00111     printf("Problem Cost Matrix:\n");
00112     printf("----------------------------------------");
00113     printf("--------------------------------------\n");
00114     
00115     /* Print cost matrix out into groups so they will (normally) fit into
00116      * an 80-character width terminal. */
00117     k = 0;
00118     while(k < problem->size)
00119     {
00120         /* Handle special case for last column */
00121         if(problem->size - k < group_size)
00122             count = problem->size - k;
00123         else
00124             count = group_size;
00125         
00126         /* Print out the header */
00127         for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00128             printf("\t[j=%d]", j);   
00129         printf("\n");
00130 
00131         /* Print out rows */
00132         for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00133         {
00134             printf("[i=%d]", i);
00135             for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00136             {
00137                 if(i == j)
00138                     printf("\t-");
00139                 else
00140                     printf("\t%d", problem->get_cost(problem, i, j));
00141             }
00142             printf("\n");
00143         }
00144         printf("\n");
00145 
00146         k += count;
00147     }
00148         
00149 }

00151 /****************************************************************************
00152  * Private function implemenations
00153  ****************************************************************************/
00154 inline int 
00155 concorde_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00156 {
00157     return problem->data.edgelen(i, j, &(problem->data));
00158 }
